noscript.div: Javascript must be enabled for the correct page display

p.span: All Waukee Community School District buildings, including District Office, are closed for the remainder of the school year. The District will continue to offer continuous learning to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. All childcare (Beyond the Bell, Live Y’ers), athletic practices, and activities are canceled effective immediately. Read more…

img.alt: District Awarded for Outstanding Financial Reporting FY19

div.h2: District Awarded for Outstanding Financial Reporting
div.a: Read more about District Awarded for Outstanding Financial Reporting
Read more about Returning Student Registration

div.h2: Coronavirus: Health Information for Families & Staff
div.a: Read more about Coronavirus: Health Information for Families & Staff
Read more about In the 'Kee with Dr. B

div.p: Families can pick up free breakfast and lunch for children under the age of 18. This will start Monday, March 23 and go until further notice.
div.a: Read more about Free Grab & Go Meals

div.p: We will be opening our 10th elementary school, Sugar Creek Elementary. The changes to boundaries in this process will go into effect for the 2022-23 school year.

article.p: Collectively, staff members work to remove barriers that may impact student progress and achievement, providing increasingly advanced coursework and instruction at all grade levels. Every employee, volunteer and community partner associated with our district works to deliver our mission and vision each day.

div.class: col-sm-offset-4 col-sm-8 col-md-offset-0 col-md-6 col-lg-offset-1 col-lg-5

div.p: Waukee High School students take AP exams each year
The Leader in Me Lighthouse elementary schools
miles driven by school buses each year

div.span: Did you know the yogurt we have been serving in our grab and go lunches is made in Iowa? Country View Dairy and the District have worked together on previous #farmtoschool initiatives, including Iowa Local Food Day. We love being able to #supportlocal Iowa industry during this time!
Thank you Laura Calvert for rolling up your sleeves to help! Calvert and her sisters made 20 masks for the Waukee Nutrition Department and 26 masks for other families in our community.
A huge thank you to the Iowa Prison Industries for sending our schools 144 gallons of hand sanitizer.

Tomorrow, Friday, April 17, Waukee Community School District will have the opportunity to give out weekend meals to families who visit one of our Free Meal Grab and Go locations. These meals are being provided by Meals from the Heartland (Taco Mac). One bag will feed a family of 4 -6. #WCSDNutrition https://waukeeschools.org/news/2020/03/district-to-provide-grab-and-go-meals-starting-march-23/

Waukee Community Schools Foundation just added two new versions of the yard signs - one for teachers and for one Waukee school supporters who may not have a child in the district anymore. They also added an option to purchase a sign for someone in need of assistance. Signs can be purchased in RevTrak https://waukee.revtrak.net/waukee-foundation-/yard-signs/#/list

The Waukee Community Schools Foundations has created a great way to support our schools and community. Customizable yard signs are available for $18. Each purchase will help support the district and community, $3 to the Waukee Area Christian Services Food Pantry, $3 to the Foundation. #GiveLove https://waukee.revtrak.net/waukee-foundation-/yard-signs/…
Construction has begun at Sugar Creek Elementary! It will be the district’s tenth elementary school, located in the southwest area of our district.

Free Grab and Go breakfast and lunch for children under the age of 18 will be available for pick up Monday-Friday from 11 a.m.-12 p.m starting Monday, March 23 until further notice at two locations; Windfield West Apartments and Sun Prairie Apartments. #WCSDNutrition More information available on our website: waukeeschools.org

Waukee Summer Bowling Camp registration is open! This area-wide four-day bowling camp offers fun learning and bowling opportunities for girls and boys in grades 1-12 of all ability levels. https://waukeeschools.org/backpack-category/camps-clinics/

The Girls' Basketball Team defeated Ames 58-35 to advance to the state tournament for the 13th time in the last 14 years. With last night's victory, head coach Chris Guess recorded his 300th win as Waukee head coach! Watch them in action at the Quarterfinals on Monday, March 2 at 1:30 pm against Sioux City East #ticketpunched
Congratulations to the Waukee High School Wrestlers on an outstanding season. They placed sixth at State Duals and ninth at the State meet. 🏆#gowarriors

Congratulations to the Waukee High School Group Speech Team for finishing their season with four incredible performances at the Iowa High School Speech Association (IHSSA) Large Group All-State Festival on February 22 at Iowa State University.

A huge thank you to everyone who came to our Legislative Learning session this morning at @EasonElem. Thank you to our legislators, Board members, staff, and community for coming together to improve youth mental health for our kids.

Congratulations to Madison Reindl, a second-grade teacher at Woodland Hills Elementary School, for being selected as the recipient of The 2020 Waukee Community Schools Foundation Award for Teaching. https://waukeeschools.org/news/2020/02/woodland-hills-teacher-is-awarded-2020-excellence-award/
Waukee High School Boys' Swim Team brought home a third-place trophy for the 2020 Iowa State Swim Championships! Congratulations on an outstanding season! 🏆 #GoWaukee #WarriorPride

a.aria-label: Click or Press enter to view how we create Waukee through Innovation
Click or Press enter to view how we create Waukee through Collaboration
Click or Press enter to view how we create Waukee through Mindfulness

div.p: Innovation is our evolution of thought, the enthusiasm for growth and a commitment to new ideas.
Innovation is our dedication to understanding the complex and original ways of the world. It is our mind work.
Collaboration is our loyalty to partnership, the passion for dialogue and a steady intention towards improvement.
Collaboration is our exploration of connectedness and identity. It's our hand work.
Mindfulness is our intentional practice of introspection, the knowing of ourselves and the giving and receiving joy.
Mindfulness is our alertness to the directions we are headed and the diligence we embrace to get there. It's our heart work.
